programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.sub-title: La haute couture face à la pandémie
programme.desc:
Season 6, Episode 35:

Haute couture in a pandemic How to face up to the Covid-19 pandemic in the world of haute couture? Alexis Mabille and the artists and craftsmen working in the world of fashion offer their answers. Focus on the photographers and runway show organisers who invented sustainable alternatives to bring back the lost magic.

Commentary by: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Thai cuisine We explore Thai cuisine with Bruno Blanchet. From green papaya salad to coconut milk soup, the chefs Yao Truadmakkha and Ramida Inthanoochit help us discover the flavours of their cuisine. Presenter: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: La vigne est belle
programme.desc:
The alchemists
November. The winegrowers prepare the vineyards and warehouses for the winter. It's time to blend the year's wines and for the Mexican and Guatemalan seasonal workers to return home. The year ends with tastings, good 'piquettes' recipes, retirement for some and concerns about climate change.
Director: Pascal Brouard (Canada, 2022)

programme.title: Les nouveaux nomades
programme.desc: Éric takes us to explore the marshes of the Charente-Maritime, an ideal ecosystem for horse breeding. Nathalie tries making Gigondas, in Orange. In Laval, Julie meets Mounir, a super presenter doing everything possible to connect people. In Paris, Yvan presents one of the most surprising "women from the 6th floor". Presented by: Éric Perrin, Nathalie Simon, Julie Hattu, Yvan Hallouin.

programme.title: Épicerie fine, terroirs gourmands
programme.desc: The Sancerrois The Sancerrois: an unspoilt micro-region on the banks of the Loire. Éric Louis welcomes us to his vineyards to share in his love of Sancerre wine, the Godon family let us in on the secrets of Crottin de Chavignol cheese, and we explore the Gargaude islands with Florence Delaroche. Presenter: Guy Martin.

programme.title: Ça roule en cuisine
programme.sub-title: Le restaurant bio Claire et Hugo
programme.desc: Claire and Hugo's organic restaurant Sophie Menut drives towards Sainte-Savine, just outside Troyes, and Claire and Hugo's organic restaurant. Chef Claire Baubrit and baker Hugo Lallemand are both self-taught and passionate about their profession. They also had a food truck, before taking on the challenge of opening a real restaurant with its own bakery-grocery store. Presented by: Sophie Menut.

programme.title: Maestro !
programme.desc: Rigoletto Three acts and four scenes for "Rigoletto", by Giuseppe Verdi, based on a play by Victor Hugo "Le Roi S'Amuse", created at the Teatro La Fenice in 1851. With extracts from Claus Guth's 2016 production at the Opéra de Paris. Presented by: Éric de Lochner. Directed by: Éric de Lochner (France, 2021)

programme.title: Passe-moi les jumelles
programme.desc:
Encounter with an atypical but truly authentic baker from the Jura, then an immersive experience amidst the exotic and local wildlife of the Geneva Biopark as we discover a whole new world of sound and image.
Presented by: Matthieu Fournier.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.desc: Vegan galettes Kimberly Lallouz presents her galettes that are 100% vegan, made with beans and chick peas, accompanied by a special sauce, plus potatoes seasoned with Montreal spices. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Thalassa
programme.desc:
Vanuatu, the secret archipelago
Vanuatu, in the heart of Melanesia and 300 km from New Caledonia, lives to the rhythm of its volcanic eruptions. Its people, and their traditions steeped in myths and legends, were long sheltered from the influences of the modern world. Today Vanuatu is increasingly open to international tourism...
Presented by: Sabine Quindou.

programme.title: Un opéra pour un empire
programme.desc: Famous for its ghost, Opéra Garnier was a titanic construction project and showcase for the Second Empire. From 1852 to 1870, Paris became the capital of modernity. Behind the scenes, machinery, architectural details and legends, we look back at the building of the opera house designed by Charles Garnier. Directed by: Patrick Cabouat (France, 2020)

programme.title: Ô la belle vie
programme.desc: Sète, a family affair Overlooking the Étang de Thau to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south, Sète is a peninsula open to the world, welcoming men and women from all corners of the Mediterranean down the centuries. A crossroads for trade and historical culture, an inspiring town, vibrant with life! Presented by: Sophie Jovillard.

programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.desc:
Programme summary: vegan leather goods; adapting plants from far away in order to grow them in France; a visit to the Bambouseraie, a bamboo garden in the Gard; designing a flowering border for Jérémy.
Presented by: Stéphane Marie, Carole Tolila.

programme.title: Pistes vertes
programme.sub-title: Gonnes Girls/La Consigne/Phytoépuration/Un quotition plus vert
programme.desc: Claire and Gaëlle left their city life behind to manage an organic farm called Les Gonnes Girls. Aline created La Consigne, Normandy's first packaging-free grocery store. Discovery of phytopurification. Marion, an environmental consultant, gives us tips for a greener daily life. Presented by: Laurent Quembre.

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc: Jouy-en-Josas, to visit the Toile de Jouy museum. The Argentinean chef Juan Arbelaez invites us into his kitchen, filled with a thousand and one flavours. Schiaparelli, the perfect combination of art and fashion through collections inspired by surrealism. The restorer Isabelle Pitre offers paintings and artworks all their original beauty. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: La main à la pâte
programme.desc: Honey from Girouxville Near Girouxville and Fahler in northern Alberta, Luc lends a hand to Paul Benoit, a beekeeper who got into honey production more than forty years ago. Presenter: Luc Jean.

programme.title: L'art et la matière
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Pays et marchés du monde
programme.desc: Cracovie (Pologne) Découverte du marché Stary Kleparz à Cracovie. Présentation : Xavier Petit.

programme.desc:

programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: La recette de Guy Martin
programme.sub-title: Ravioles de morilles et brousse de brebis
programme.desc: Morel mushroom and brousse sheep cheese ravioli, chicken stock with hazelnut oil The Michelin-starred chef Guy Martin presents products emblematic of France and suggests a recipe to prepare them. Presented by: Guy Martin.
